_description: The hymn ‘A patre unigenitus’ — five stanzas rhyme royal

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Goddis son and lord omnipotentEternally by only
                    geniture…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…Defend the ceptyr of thyne hymaniteWyth thy shelde of perfyt
                    deite
BLAdd34193.Editions:
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 22-4.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             “Hymnal from MS. Additional 34193, British Museum.” 
             Medieval Studies in Memory of Gertrude Schoepperle Loomis.
            Roger Sherman Loomis, ed. 
         New York: Columbia UP, 1927: 443-88: 462-4.
